intro: Mikania heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant features alternate, usually heart-shaped leaves that vary in size and shape, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale blue, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Mikania heterophylla is often found in disturbed areas, along roadsides, and in open woodlands.
